basics.name: Solis Winters
basics.summary: A Health Policy PhD Candidate at UC Berkeley, with research interests in maternal and child health, HIV, causal inference, and impact evaluation

education.institution: University of California, Berkeley School of Public Health
education.area: Graduate Certificate in Applied Data Science
Dissertation Chair: Dr. Lia Fernald, Brian and Jennifer Maxwell Endowed Professor in Public Health
Committee Members: Dr. Sandra McCoy, Dr. Alan Hubbard, Dr. Susana Matias
education.studyType: PhD, Health Policy, Population & Data Science

education.institution: Saint Louis University College for Public Health and Social Justice
education.area: Minors in Engineering Mathematics and Urban Poverty Studies
courses: Biostatistics Capstone: 'The black-white disparities in preterm birth rates in St. Louis City and County'
Honors Program Capstone: 'Understanding the role of social support among low food-secure adults in Missouri'

publications.summary: Please find a complete list of publications [here](https://soliswinters.github.io/publications).

work.name: University of California, Berkeley School of Public Health
work.summary: Support data management and monitoring for two randomized trials evaluating the effectiveness of cash incentives for supporting out-of-care people living with HIV and in-care people living with HIV who are predicted through machine learning to be at risk for disengaging from care in Tanzania.

work.name: University of California, Berkeley School of Public Health
work.summary: Led data management, monitoring, and statistical analysis for a cluster randomized control trial to test whether cash incentives can improve treatment adherence among people living with HIV in Tanzania.

work.name: International Initiative for Impact Evaluation (3ie)
work.summary: Led the analysis for the impact evaluation of a nutrition randomized trial in Baja Verapaz, Guatemala and assisted with development of the manuscript.

work.name: University of California, San Francisco School of Nursing
work.summary: Wrote, updated, and revised R Markdown code to generate monthly, tailored reports based on customer feedback data for drug shop owners enrolled in a randomized controlled trial in Tanzania.

work.name: International Initiative for Impact Evaluation (3ie)
work.summary: Synthesized evidence around key questions for policymakers in the Philippines as they prepared to respond to challenges posed by COVID-19.

work.name: Inter-American Development Bank, Office of Strategic Planning and Development Effectiveness
work.summary: Provided technical support for impact evaluations and research in maternal and child health and nutrition.

work.name: Saint Louis University College for Public Health and Social Justice
work.summary: Interviewed parents for a qualitative research study to understand the relationship between sleep habits and health among young children in St. Louis.

work.name: American Institutes for Research
work.summary: Assisted in the evaluation of Plantwise Kenya, a project focused on improving plant health in Kenya by training extension agents and expanding farmer access to plant health information.

awards.title: Outstanding Bachelor of Science in Biostatistics Graduating Senior Award
awards.awarder: Saint Louis University College for Public Health and Social Justice
awards.summary: 'This award honors an individual that shows leadership performance & potential, scholastic achievement, and manifestations of the College Covenant in personal conduct.'
